meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rigid.
meanings.sent1: The rigidity of the metal made it difficult to bend.
meanings.sent2: The rigidity of the frozen tree branches indicated the severity of the winter.
meanings.sent3: The rigidity of the ruler's stance on the new policy was unwavering.
meanings.sent4: The rigidity of the old oak tree symbolized strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The rigidity of the steel beam made it a reliable support structure.

meanings.definition: The inability to be bent or flexed.
meanings.sent1: The rigidity of the frozen ground made it impossible to dig.
meanings.sent2: The rigidity of the metal rod prevented it from being twisted.
meanings.sent3: The rigidity of the rubber band after being left in the sun was comical.
meanings.sent4: The rigidity of the old door hinge made it difficult to open.
meanings.sent5: The rigidity of the frozen lock kept the door securely closed.

meanings.definition: Strictness or inflexibility in rules or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The rigidity of the school's dress code caused frustration among students.
meanings.sent2: The rigidity of his religious beliefs left no room for interpretation.
meanings.sent3: The rigidity of the traffic laws was evident during rush hour.
meanings.sent4: The rigidity of her schedule made it challenging to make last-minute plans.
meanings.sent5: The rigidity of the company's policies stifled creativity among employees.
